ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Twisting Questions
ygData.msgSnippet: 2 words: Cross-Dressers! And i agree with you, many female characters get alot of gifts, scary i tell you. P.S. Ever see a female troll in plate. I swear that
ygData.messageBody:
2 words: Cross-Dressers!

And i agree with you, many female characters get alot of gifts, scary i tell
you.

P.S. Ever see a female troll in plate. I swear that has gotta be uglier then
a mother in law with a head full of curling rollers

Minkin



-----Original Message-----
From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
Sent: November 13, 2000 12:42 PM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Twisting Questions


Don't be too sure! I know of at least 4 women who are 'playing the other
way' just so they don't have to deal with the constant inanities they heard
from some players. They do admit they miss all the free gifts though ;-)

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
Sent: Monday, November 13, 2000 10:40 AM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Twisting Questions


Hah! At least us women can be fairly certain the guys we're flirting with
are really guys!
*grins*

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Reeves, Patrick W [mailto:pwr3@...]
> Sent: Monday, November 13, 2000 10:29 AM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Twisting Questions
>
>
> YA! More geriatrics! I am 36 myself (37 next month), and I
> usually have to
> break out the icepacks if I have been doing a marathon session on the
> weekends. Let the youngins swap instruments/weapons every
> beat, I'd rather
> be having a beer and flirting with the cute wood elf (once I
> have made sure
> she is really a she, lol) :)
>
> Rokenn
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Daniel Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
> > Sent: Monday, November 13, 2000 8:19 AM
> > To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Twisting Questions
> >
> >
> > I've been playing EQ since release - and have just
> > dinged to 51. I have
> > never switched weapons during combat. I agree with Rokenn
> > that it's only
> > for the most dedicated player. Maybe it also has to do with
> > age (I'm 38)
> > and lack of finger dexterity (I find it enough work to
> twist 3 songs)!
> >
> > Also - I don't view leveling as a race. The fact that
> > other people level a
> > lot faster than I do doesn't bother me.
> >
> > It's a game - it's about having fun. As Rokenn pointed
> > out for many of
> > us - the social aspect is as important or more important than the
> > accumulation of levels and items (please don't anyone view
> > this as a flame -
> > if that is your playing styles that cool and great - just a
> matter of
> > personal taste!)
> >
> > I pretty much ALWAYS twist in combat - and never in
> > down-time. In certain
> > situations I will - but its very much the exception not the
> > rule. I need to
> > do some socializing and rest the fingers!
> >
> > Slyde Katzenjammer
> > Minstrel of 51 Tours
> > Xegony
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Reeves, Patrick W [mailto:pwr3@...]
> > Sent: Monday, November 13, 2000 9:36 AM
> > To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Twisting Questions
> >
> >
> > Constant swapping for instruments and weapons is only for the
> > truely insane.
> > I may switch back and forth during a battle as is called
> for, but not
> > constantly. You might want to remind your groupmate that EQ
> > is after all a
> > social game and it is impossible to be social while twisting
> > constantly. If
> > I am in a group and all is well, I have no problem only
> > leaving one song
> > playing so I can chat with my friends, in group, tells, or
> > guildsay. So
> > tell that monk to relax =)
> >
> > Rokenn
> >
> >
> >
